intro: Brachystegia flagristipulata, commonly known as the African brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often clustered at the base of the petioles. The tree produces yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes, which are followed by small, flat pods containing seeds. It is typically found in dry woodland and savanna habitats, where it plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various wildlife species. Its botanical features make it an important component of the region's ecological systems.
